cscd210Classes

Class Book

  • java.lang.Object
    • cscd210Classes.Book
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Book>

    public final class Book
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Book>
    Represents a simple Book class that contains a title, isbn, number of pages, and an array of authors. The class implements Comparable and uses the Generic.
    NOTE:
    final must be used on all parameters passed to a method. The this reference must be used in front of every call to class level variables. The class must be declared as final.

      private int pages
      int representing the number of pages

      String representing the title

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int compareTo(Book another)
      The compareTo method is guaranteed a Book based on the class header.
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
      The equals method checks:
      returns false if obj == null
      returns true if obj == this
      returns false if obj is not an instance of Book
      returns true if each author matches, the titles match, the isbns match, and the pages match

      The getISBN method is used by the comparator to return the isbn

      The hashCode method returns the title hash code plus the isbn hash code + the pages
      java.lang.String toString()
      The toString prints Title: the title CR Author(s): the authors comma separated CR ISBN: the isbn

    • Constructor Detail

      • Book

        public Book(java.lang.String title,
            java.lang.String isbn,
            int pages,
            java.lang.String[] authors)
        The EVC that is passed a title, isbn, pages, and array of authors
        Parameters:
        title - Representing the book title
        isbn - Representing the 13 character ISBN
        pages - Representing the number of pages
        authors - Representing an array of authors
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if title or isbn is null or empty
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if pages is < 1
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if authors is null or length is < 0
        NOTE:
        You will not blindly assign this.authors = authors; This violates encapsulation. You must make a new array and copy over the Strings from the array passed in

    • Method Detail

      • getISBN

        public java.lang.String getISBN()
        The getISBN method is used by the comparator to return the isbn
        Returns:
        String Representing the isbn

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        The toString prints Title: the title CR Author(s): the authors comma separated CR ISBN: the isbn
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        String A string as shown in the output file
        NOTE:
        There is no comma after the last author

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        The equals method checks:
        returns false if obj == null
        returns true if obj == this
        returns false if obj is not an instance of Book
        returns true if each author matches, the titles match, the isbns match, and the pages match
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        obj - Representing the potential book passed in
        Returns:
        boolean Representing true or false as stated above

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        The hashCode method returns the title hash code plus the isbn hash code + the pages
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        int Representing the hash code

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(Book another)
        The compareTo method is guaranteed a Book based on the class header. The method first compares based on the titles. If the titles are the same then it compares based on the number of pages. If the pages are the same then the isbn is compared.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Book>
        Parameters:
        another - Representing the book being passed as the argument.
        Returns:
        int Guaranteed to be a value < 0, > 0 or == 0
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if another is null
